title: How to Connect a Cricut Printer to a Computer: Bluetooth & USB

steps.title: Turn on your Cricut and make sure it's 10-15 feet from your computer.
steps.content: Turn on your Cricut and make sure it's 10-15 feet from your computer. If you have the earlier version of Cricut (like a Cricut Explore or Cricut Explore One), you'll need to use a wireless adapter to connect to your computer. [1] X Research source If you have a Cricut Maker 3 or Cricut Explore 3, you'll want to connect via Bluetooth to avoid an error that's common with Windows computers that have AMD Ryzen chips.

steps.title: Open Settings.
steps.content: Open Settings. You can do this by pressing Win + I or by clicking the Start logo in your taskbar and clicking the gear icon. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click Devices.
steps.content: Click Devices . It's the icon with a speaker and keyboard. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Make sure Bluetooth is on and click Add Bluetooth or other device.
steps.content: Make sure Bluetooth is on and click Add Bluetooth or other device . The toggle under "Bluetooth" should be colored and pointing right to indicate that it's on. [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Bluetooth.
steps.content: Click Bluetooth . This is usually the first option on the list. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click your Cricut from the list.
steps.content: Click your Cricut from the list. If you have multiple Cricuts, you can see which one you want to connect to based on the device code, which you can generally find at the bottom of the machine. [6] X Research source Cricuts are usually listed as Audio .

steps.title: Click Connect.
steps.content: Click Connect . If you're prompted to enter a PIN, type in "0000." After you've connected, open Design Space to continue with your designs .

steps.title: Turn on your Cricut and ensure it's 10-15 feet from your computer.
steps.content: Turn on your Cricut and ensure it's 10-15 feet from your computer. If you have the earlier version of Cricut (like a Cricut Explore or Cricut Explore One), you'll need to use a wireless adapter to connect to your computer.

steps.title: Open System Preferences.
steps.content: Open System Preferences. To do this, click the Apple icon in the top menu and select System Preferences .

steps.title: Click Bluetooth.
steps.content: Click Bluetooth . You might find this in the third grouping of menu options.

steps.title: Ensure Bluetooth is on and click your Cricut from the list.
steps.content: Ensure Bluetooth is on and click your Cricut from the list. You should see "On" next to "Bluetooth:" on the left side of the window. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Click Pair.
steps.content: Click Pair . If you're prompted for a code, enter "0000." [8] X Research source Your Cricut is connected via Bluetooth to your Mac even though you might not see "Connected" in the status bar unless you're actively using the Cricut machine. [9] X Research source After you've connected, open Design Space to continue with your designs .

steps.title: Turn your Cricut on.
steps.content: Turn your Cricut on. It doesn't have a maximum distance requirement like the Bluetooth connection does, but you don't want to strain your USB cable either. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Connect a USB cable between your computer and the Cricut machine.
steps.content: Connect a USB cable between your computer and the Cricut machine. If you purchased a brand-new Cricut machine, it should have come with a USB cable. If you need a USB cable, you can always purchase one from the Cricut website .

steps.title: Download and install Design Space.
steps.content: Download and install Design Space. Go to https://design.cricut.com/ in a web browser and follow the on-screen instructions to download and install the Cricut software. Once you create an account with Design Space, it should automatically detect your connected Cricut machine and download the appropriate drivers.

steps.title: Check that your Cricut supports Bluetooth if you're trying to connect that way.
steps.content: Check that your Cricut supports Bluetooth if you're trying to connect that way. Cricut Maker, Explore Air, and Explore Air 2 have built-in Bluetooth. The Cricut Explore and Explore One need a Bluetooth adapter before they can be used wirelessly.

steps.title: If Design Space is not able to automatically download your divers on Windows, go to the help page and click here to download the Cricut Drivers .zip files.
steps.content: If Design Space is not able to automatically download your divers on Windows, go to the help page and click here to download the Cricut Drivers .zip files . Find and unzip the downloaded Drivers folder and extract the files to a location you'll remember. To install the drivers , open Device Manager and locate your Cricut machine in the panel on the left side of the window. Right-click the machine, then select Browse my computer for driver software . Next, enter the location in which you extracted the zipped folder (you can type it in or browse your File Manager to find it) and click Next . Finally, the extracted contents of the zipped folder will be installed. To complete the process, restart your computer .

steps.title: If your PC isn't finding your Cricut, make sure Windows Firewall isn't blocking the machine.
steps.content: If your PC isn't finding your Cricut, make sure Windows Firewall isn't blocking the machine. To fix this and allow your Cricut through the Firewall , press the Win key and enter "Windows Firewall." Click the "Allow an app through Windows Firewall" in the list of search results and those settings will open. [11] X Research source Once the "Allowed apps" window opens, click Change settings then scroll through the list and select the Cricut software. Finally, change those to "Public" and "Private" and click OK .

steps.title: Make sure your Bluetooth is on or that the USB cable is fully connected.
steps.content: Make sure your Bluetooth is on or that the USB cable is fully connected. To check that Bluetooth is enabled, press Win + I then click Devices and make sure that the toggle next to "Bluetooth" is turned on (it should be colored and pointing right). To make sure the USB cable is fully connected, ensure that each end of the cable is not wobbly or loose, as that could cause an interruption in data flow and might prevent your computer from recognizing your Cricut machine. Also check the length of the cable for any breaks, tears, or anything else that could interrupt data flow. Try a different USB cable to rule out that variable.

steps.title: Turn Bluetooth off and back on.
steps.content: Turn Bluetooth off and back on. Sometimes, you just need to refresh the connection to get it working again. Press Win + I and click Devices to turn off Bluetooth and turn it back on. [12] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Turn the Cricut off and back on again.
steps.content: Turn the Cricut off and back on again. If you've refreshed your Bluetooth connection and your computer and Cricut still aren't connecting, turning the machine off and back on might work.
